profiles:
Summary - Experienced and versatile researcher with 7+ years of experience, passionate about championing the voice of the consumer to impact decision making. 
- Strong experience in strategic data driven research through rigorous analytical skills by effectively collaborating with diverse, cross-functional teams for driving the execution of projects. 
- Extensive vendor and client side market research experience driven by new challenges and learning opportunities. Summary - Experienced and versatile researcher with 7+ years of experience, passionate about championing the voice of the consumer to impact decision making. 
- Strong experience in strategic data driven research through rigorous analytical skills by effectively collaborating with diverse, cross-functional teams for driving the execution of projects. 
- Extensive vendor and client side market research experience driven by new challenges and learning opportunities. - Experienced and versatile researcher with 7+ years of experience, passionate about championing the voice of the consumer to impact decision making. 
- Strong experience in strategic data driven research through rigorous analytical skills by effectively collaborating with diverse, cross-functional teams for driving the execution of projects. 
- Extensive vendor and client side market research experience driven by new challenges and learning opportunities. - Experienced and versatile researcher with 7+ years of experience, passionate about championing the voice of the consumer to impact decision making. 
- Strong experience in strategic data driven research through rigorous analytical skills by effectively collaborating with diverse, cross-functional teams for driving the execution of projects. 
- Extensive vendor and client side market research experience driven by new challenges and learning opportunities. Experience Research Manager - Brand and Audience Intel Corporation April 2015  – Present (5 months) Santa Clara, CA Staff Market Researcher/Consumer Insights Lead Intel Corporation October 2013  –  April 2015  (1 year 7 months) Santa Clara, CA - Part of Intel's Global Marketing and Communications (GMC) group driving research on feature prioritization for notebooks, Chromebooks and future platforms  
 Sr Market Researcher Intel Corporation March 2012  –  October 2013  (1 year 8 months) Santa Clara, CA - Responsible for all primary research to help gather critical insights on consumer behavior and attitude towards media and champion the voice of the US TV subscriber and prospect into the different teams in the organization. 
- Work closely with cross functional teams to provide research insights to help inform marketing strategy and drive key decisions within the marketing team, content and product. 
- Partner with key stakeholders on an ongoing basis to understand business goals, and formulate approaches to get insights on topics spread across content preference, pricing, and value prop and feature set. 
- Manage all aspects of primary research projects that involved scoping and designing research projects -collaborating with internal stakeholders , identifying objectives, determining appropriate research methodology, questionnaire design, designing analytic plans, helping with analysis, interpretation of results 
- Established internal product assessment (“dogfood”) program 
- Manage research budget and align external vendors to Intel Media’s objectives. Project Director Socratic Technologies October 2010  –  March 2012  (1 year 6 months) San Francisco, CA - Perform survey design, project execution, data management, statistical analysis, and reporting at leading vendor of Internet-based Market Research. 
- Review of initial questionnaire drafts from clients and quality check surveys (for consistency, flow, logic, and response rates) prior to programming and launch. 
- Coordinate project related tasks with the Operations teams (Survey Programming, Data Processing, Coding etc) 
- Use proprietary tools for gathering data and viewing results to monitor field progress and recognize trends as they develop in real-time. 
- Use SPSS statistical software to provide complete in-depth quantitative analysis of survey results and serve as a resource for analytics such as crosstabs, correlation analysis, factor analysis, Brand power Analysis. 
- Conduct research for diverse purposes, including product concept testing, customer satisfaction, customer attitudes, brand awareness and market segmentation for clients across various domains such as healthcare, social network gaming and hi-tech. 
- Analyze data collected through qualitative techniques such online group moderation/Web discussion boards. 
- Manage research analysts at the San Francisco office as well as at an offshore site in India Strategist/Project Manager TATTOO Brand Strategy February 2010  –  April 2010  (3 months) San Francisco, CA - Planned and conducted qualitative research to provide strategic brand and consumer insight. 
- Managed all aspects of a project through completion including recruitment, tracking constituency goals, in-market schedules, and project deliverables  
- Supervised and Managed a team of interns 
- Clients : CNN.COM, Cadbury and Star City & Casino (Australia) Senior Research Analyst The Smart Cube March 2007  –  December 2008  (1 year 10 months) New Delhi Area, India - Conducted market research to determine customer needs and impressions of department goods and services 
- Designed survey instruments and coordinated the collection of data; compiled information, analyzed results and prepared reports setting forth customer attitudes and trends and appropriate marketing recommendations and conclusions. 
- Conducted brand analysis, product positioning studies, new product/market entry research, market trend and competitor analysis. 
- Conducted strategic analysis including Porters analysis, SWOT and presented results in a report format. 
- Worked on company/industry research reports geared towards drawing specific insights that typically feed into a client’s business strategy 
- Worked on research activities to identify customer preferences and attitudes and to enhance products and service 
- Worked on databases such as Dialog, LexisNexis, Kompass and OneSource for data accumulation and use of Web Analytics such as Nielsen Net Ratings and Hitwise 
- Prepared reports of findings, illustrating data graphically and translating complex findings into written text 
- Worked with fortune 500 clients Summer Intern Electrolux May 2006  –  July 2006  (3 months) Project Undertaken: Consumer need gap study for product development and importance of consumer benefits 
- Acted as an assistant research analyst, caried out telephone interviews and focus groups within a market segment  
- Analysed data to study the various factors affecting the purchase decision of Air Conditioners and to try and sell in those gaps where the product lacks the most, by providing the company with useful insight, suggestions and product recommendations. Experience Sales Representative Trainee Pfizer January 2014  –  June 2014  (6 months) Changchun, Jilin, China 1.finish the sales task 
2.follow my manager 
3.attend the academic conference as a staff Market Researcher Intel Corporation January 2012  –  2012  (less than a year) Changchun, Jilin, China Sales The Coca-Cola Company July 2011  –  August 2011  (2 months) Changchun, Jilin, China As a sales girl of Coca-Cola, I have to finish today's sales task. If I did more, I will acquire bonus. Not only every day I can complete sales task, but also I will exceed. The leader is very satisfied. I have accumulated some experience in sales, and also it is the first time I stand in the seller's position on rather than as a customer. I have to consider the needs of customers, advantage of the commodity I sell and how to successfully sell my goods.
